content: waiting for mistletoe design by anna mäkilä fb anna m designs instagram @annamdesigns what would christmas be without mistletoe mistletoe has been an inseparable part of my childhood christmas a few days before christmas mistletoe appeared on the kitchen ceiling and stayed there until at least the new year when it disappeared christmas was over i hope you enjoy knitting it you will need fingering-weight sock yarn 400-420 m / 100 g main colour mc 25-40 g contrast colour cc 30-45 g for contrast colour you can use one two or so many yarns as you wish i used 2 different ccs needles 2 00 mm and 2 25 mm if needed or size needed to obtain correct gauge and tapestry needle the pattern is written for magic loop but you can use dpns or 2 circular needles as well gauge 36 sts and 46 rds = 10 cm in stockinette sizes s 64 sts m 72 sts and l 80 sts 1 waiting for mistletoe clue 1 in this pattern colorwork is only 6 rounds each time if you prefer you can change to larger needles for colorwork abbreviations cc contrast colour mc main colour k knit kfb knit in the front and back round s round s st s stitch es toe with mc cast on 20/24/28 sts using your favourite toe-up cast-on i suggest using the turkish cast on https //www garnstudio com/video php id=96&lang=en divide stitches evenly over both needles knit 1 round then start to increase round 1 on the instep kfb knit to the last 2 sts kfb k1 repeat on the sole round 2 knit all sts repeat rounds 1 and 2 until you have 64/72/80 sts 32/36/40 sts on both the instep and the sole end with round 2 foot attach cc to start colorwork following chart a for the first sock and chart b for the second if you wish you can weave in the ends as you go using this tip https //www garnstudio com/video php id=139&page=2&lang=en repeat stitches 1 4 a total of 16/18/20 times in the round work row 1 14 until the foot measures at least 8/10/10 cm 3 25/4/4 inches less than desired finished length and the last worked row is 7/3/3 in the socks in the photo row 1 14 of chart a/b were repeated three times and additionally row 1 3 key 2 chart a chart b 3 waiting for mistletoe clue 2 abbreviations k2tog knit 2 sts together p purl p2tog tbl purl 2 sts together through the back loop rs right side ssk slip 1 st knitwise yarn in back pass it back to left needle knit next 2 sts together through the back loop ws wrong side heel heel increases are worked in the solid-color section of chart a/b 16 sts are added in each repeat of the chart after starting the increases you will work chart a/b depending on
